dict.string: First, you need an observation of something. This allows for a question about it and a hypothesis to be made.
You then need a question that you hope to answer in your investigation that is based off of your observations.
A hypothesis is what you think the answer to the question will be. This allows you to create an experiment to answer the question.
Here, you make a prediction for how your experiment will turn out. This is not an answer to the question, just what you think will happen in the experiment.
An experiment is then formulated using the multiple variables and hypothesis to do so.
The experiment is done and the data is then collected to be anylized
The data from the experiment then discussed and a conclusion is made about whether or not the hypthesis was correct.
The variable that you change in your experiment to effect the dependent variable
The variable that you are focusing on and taking data on.
Also known as a constant, a controlled variable is a variable of the environment of testing that you keep constant or the same through out your experiment, like temperature or altitude

Similar to a controlled variable, a standardized variable is a variable that you keep the same for all the tests, but is a little more general than a controlled variable. It encompasses the test subject (or object) and it's origin. Some examples are the speceise of animal or location that it came from.
